text: hi everyone big city
head tanno here the internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
this new preoccupations album
Arrangements this is the fourth
full-length LP from Calgary rock outfit
preoccupations which comes several years
after they're accurately advertised new
material in 2018 and yes the band really
did try out some new material on this
record it just so happened to be in my
opinion their worst material there were
attempts to work electronic and
Industrial elements into the band's
already cold and Eerie brand of postpunk
but the end results were pretty dodgy
but Arrangements here is another new
step at this time I think in a better
Direction with the Smoky and passionate
lead vocals as well as the bright and
angular guitar leads that we've heard on
previous albums now being met with way
more effects and layers of noise even
strings at one point the result is a
series of tracks that comes off a lot
darker more brooding more shoegazy and
more goth friendly too the track list
here is built on seven very patient
songs so it's pretty easy to get a grip
of which sections of the record are not
working and which ones are like the
album defining opener fixed bayonets
which gives a pretty solid idea of the
kind of Sonic chaos we're going to be in
for for the rest of this project we have
lots of sharp and bright guitars
layering up gradually against very tight
and Punchy drums the song at the core of
this track though I could kind of take
or leave I wouldn't call it
preoccupations uh most sticky lead vocal
or Melody but the gradual build of noise
and Distortion that reaches a fuzzy
fever pitch in the last leg is pretty
great Ricochet by comparison isn't as
heavy on the sound play but the tune
here is a lot snappier especially with
these 80s style synths sliding in on the
hook the light rasp on the vocals as
well makes this track feel like uh
something Future Islands would write and
record if they were doing a full Tour
opening up for uh Sisters of Mercy or
Bauhaus we also have the kind of
questionable single death of Melody
which kind of seems like an experiment
to see how much of a slow burning song
could translate through uh these sort of
pitchy off-kilter wailing guitar layers
on top of it and the answer is not much
I don't really mind some extra noise in
concept I mean after all that is kind of
the draw for at least a few other tracks
here but this is the rare instance on
this L key where that bit of noise on
top of everything felt a little too
loose and chaotic and didn't really add
to or contribute to the song underneath
it this is handling my least favorite
track on the lp even if it does come
together a bit more tightly in the
second half we then have the very
haunting slowly which as far as layering
goes reaches some of the most epic highs
on the entire LP not only that but the
guitar and vocal leads that soar over
everything else in the mix are pretty
powerful the whole track is insanely
catchy despite it really taking its time
progressing we also have the enchanting
and multi-phased advisor where we hear a
droning strange otherworldly intro
eventually progressing into these loose
psychedelic rock guitars in 3-4 some
storybook strings building on top of
that as we eventually bust into this
driving shoegazy Rock passage very goth
very dark wave very Subterranean with
fiery vocals calling out through all the
Sonic Haze it is textured and it's
beautiful recalibrate however feels
almost like an extension of some of the
more experimental bits from the last
record it is very harsh and very Stark
in its presentation some more subtle
industrial elements being worked in too
but now with these Eerie cultish vocal
harmonies uh calling out against the
instrumental I actually love the whole
first half of the song because of the
sound palette and instrumental layering
that it brings to the table but it
suddenly morphs into these very shrill
blindingly bright side guitars all of a
sudden this section of the track is
suddenly kind of switches to I just
don't find to be anywhere near as
gratifying in fact it feels very tacked
on and uh just not really all that
complementary to everything that had
brought us to that point then we have
these steady closer tearing up the grass
which has the driving repetition of a
trout rock or like a David Bowie song or
maybe LCD sound system if they were
covered in black leather and eyeliner
but a lot like the opener I enjoy the
tightness of the band here I enjoy the
pacing of it I enjoy the groove and the
repetition of that Groove but the song
I'm just not really all that enamored
with the riffs and Melodies just don't
come off all that memorable but I can't
deny with the band's performance there
is some kinetic energy there but yeah
overall This Record uh quality wise and
enjoyment wise was a little all over the
place some songs had a strong song at
their core others didn't some tracks had
some amazing and fantastic and well
crafted sound play others didn't but
generally speaking it was pretty cool to
hear the band taking a risk in a bit
more of a shoegaze direction I suppose
I'm feeling a strong six on this LP
transition have you given this album a
listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
or the best what should I review next
hit the like if you like Please
Subscribe and please don't cry hit the
Bell as well over here next to my head
is another video that you can check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel Anthony fantano
preoccupations forever
